description: MongoDB Dashboard with Cluster, Replication, cursor, and server metrics using Mongodb Exporter by percona

panels.description: Mongodb Service Uptime in hours
panels.title: Mongodb Uptime

panels.description: The number of incoming connections from clients to the database server. This number includes the current shell session. Consider the value of connections.available to add more context to this datum.
panels.title: Current Connections

panels.description: Count of all incoming connections created to the server. This number includes connections that have since closed.
panels.title: Total Created Connections

panels.description: The number of unused incoming connections available. Consider this value in combination with the value of connections.current to understand the connection load on the database, and the UNIX ulimit Settings document for more information about system thresholds on available connections.
panels.title: Available Connections

panels.description: The number of active client connections to the server. Active client connections refers to client connections that currently have operations in progress.
panels.title: Active Connections

options.content: A document that reports on database operations by type since the mongod instance last started. These numbers will grow over time until next restart. Analyze these values over time to track database utilization.

panels.description: The total number of insert operations received since the mongod instance last started.
panels.title: Received Insert Operations

panels.description: The total number of update operations received since the mongod instance last started.
panels.title: Received Update Operations

panels.description:
The total number of commands issued to the database since the mongod instance last started.

opcounters.command counts all commands except the write commands: insert, update, and delete.
panels.title: Received Command Operations

panels.description: The total number of queries received since the mongod instance last started.
panels.title: Received Queries

panels.description: The total number of delete operations since the mongod instance last started.
panels.title: Received Delete Operations

panels.description: The total number of getMore operations since the mongod instance last started. This counter can be high even if the query count is low. Secondary nodes send getMore operations as part of the replication process.
panels.title: Received getMore Operations

panels.description: Number of collections in the database.
panels.title: Total Collections/DB

panels.description: Total number of indexes across all collections in the database.
panels.title: Total Indexs/DB

panels.description: Number of views in the database.
panels.title: Total Views/DB

panels.description: Sum of the space allocated to all collections in the database for document storage, including free space.
panels.title: Allocated Storage to Collections in DB

panels.description: Sum of the space allocated to all indexes in the database, including free index space.
panels.title: Allocated Storage to Indexs in DB

panels.description: The oplog (operations log) is a special capped collection that keeps a rolling record of all operations that modify the data stored in your databases.
panels.title: OPLog Size

panels.description: Chart using top queries about top 10 command with highest counts
panels.title: Top 10 MongoDB Commands  by count

panels.description: Chart about the top command with most of time queries in interval of Mongodb
panels.title: Top 10 MongoDB Commands by times

panels.description: Cursor is a pointer, and using this pointer we can access the document. cursor.timeOut property was updated incrementally, and connections that died without closing the cursor. The consequence is that it will remain open on the server and consume memory unless it is reaped by the default MongoDB setting.
panels.title: Cursor Timeout

panels.description: Number of cursors currently opened by MongoDB for clients
panels.title: Cursor totalOpened

title: Mongodb Metrics Dashboard
